Hogyan tudom a Thunderbird-öt rávenni, hogy ezek is töltse le, illetve az összes többi levelet ami a törölt üzenetek mappában van? Előre is köszönöm a segítséget!
creator: defender1

title: Fallo intermitente de configuración SMTP Thunderbird
content:
Buenas,

Tengo a una usuaria que está teniendo un fallo extraño. Utilizamos un dominio de correo de Google Workspaces. Tenemos el servidor SMTP de gmail correctamente configurado en su Thunderbird, cuando abre el programa puede enviar y recibir correos sin problema. Pasado un rato, le aparece un mensaje conforme hay un error en la configuración del servidor SMTP.

Tras cerrar y volver a abrir el programa, vuelve a funcionar durante un rato hasta que vuelve a tener el mismo problema. Para hacerlo mas extraño, hay días que le sucede y días que no.

Se os ocurre algo que pueda causar esta problemática?

Salut
creator: rmocholi

title: Gmail account no sent folder, only INBOX
content:
I use version 102.8.0 on two Win11 laptops. Since 06/03/2023 the Sent folder for my Gmail account has disappeared from both laptops.

When I look under "subscribe" only the Inbox is shown.

I'm not sure when the folder disappeared but it can't have been more than a day or two before 06/03/2023.

I've tried unchecking "place a copy" but this makes no difference.

I don't use extensions.

The fact that it affects two different laptops suggests to me that it is a problem with the way Thunderbird interfaces with Gmail.

Has anyone else encountered and solve a problem like this?

Thanks
creator: balrog1555

title: yubikey 5 nfc support (with gpg keys in thunderbird v100 or higher)
content:
Dear Security/Dev. Team

Is there a plan to implement Smartcard Features (Yubikey 5 nfc for example) to use in Thunderbird? (In the near future) I'm talking about having gnuPG keys on my Yubikey...

I have a Yubikey with the MasterKey on it. And it would be great if i can make Thunderbird "attaching" my smartcard with the private key and import the public key....(Public Key's are not the problem, but i'm not able to Link the Smartcard with the masterkey to thunderbird).

I know, that i can have the private & public key on the filesystem, but that's not the idea if you have a smartcard.... I'm sure you got my point...

Any Ideas if you gonna plan to implement that? Best Greets and thank you in advance! Phil placzek
creator: phil190

title: How to save email addresses to second Address Book
content: I POP 3 different email addresses in Thunderbird (102.6.1) and have separate, unique address books for each in addition to the default "All address Books" and "Personal Address Book". When trying to save an individual email address from within a message I find only how to click it and add it to the "All Address Books" -main/default folder. While that's all well and good but I then have to go to the address books and move a copy of the address from there to the mailbox unique to an email account. My setting any of the unique address books to "default" does not change this "save" behavior - address still goes to "all address books" only. Is there ANY way to either simultaneously - or in some "select" sequence - to save to BOTH the "All Address Books" and another mailbox? In other words can you save to two mail boxes at once? Any help appreciated.

title: Latest Thunderbird on Mac Takes Long Time to Open
content: After updating my 2017 iMac from OS Catalina to Ventura (13.2), TB 102.8.0 is taking more than 30 seconds to open. Once open it seems fine, so far, but that startup time is way longer than it used to be. I used Troubleshoot mode to 1) send myself a troubleshoot report via email and 2) clear the starting cache, but that didn't fix the long start-up time. My email accounts are with my website's hosting company, but I doubt the problem would be with my hosting. Please advise on what can be done in TB to address this, thanks.

title: add an SPF/TXT record for the domain as follows:  v=spf1 mx a ip4:208.215.218.0/23 -all
content:
I keep getting mailer demon on emails sent from a portal...they are all gmail accounts.

The portal site said to: add an SPF/TXT record for the domain as follows: v=spf1 mx a ip4:208.215.218.0/23 -all
creator: sales260

title: Thunderbird v102.8.0 does not open html links
content:
With the latest release 102.8.0, https links do not open when selected in the body of an email. An error message pops open that states:

This file does not have an app associated with it for performing this action. Please install an app or, if one is already installed, create an association in the Default Apps Setting page.

In Windows default apps, Firefox is set to open html file types and http/https file protocols.

The same email in Outlook opens the links in Firefox, so it appears Thunderbird does not recognise the link and not a Windows setting.
